whatIsBrc: The Blockchain RCOEM Chapter is a dynamic, student-driven initiative fostering a culture of decentralized development and blockchain programming at Shree Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and Management. Serving as a dedicated platform, the chapter empowers students with hands-on experience in the rapidly evolving field of web3 development.

BRC has organized numerous icebreaking events, with Cohorts standing out as one of the most popular initiatives. Through Cohorts, we have successfully guided many students in initiating their journey into web3 development. Notably, our team includes several hackathon winners, further exemplifying our commitment to excellence and skill development within the blockchain space.
aboutus.ourGoals: The Blockchain RCOEM Chapter is committed to empowering students in web3 development by bridging the theory-application gap through practical experiences and essential skills. We actively seek industry partnerships for internships, job opportunities, and funding, ensuring real-world applicability for student-led web3 projects.
aboutus.whyBrc: As the catalyst for Web3 adoption, the Blockchain RCOEM Chapter fosters innovation and collaboration at Shree Ramdeobaba College of Engineering and Management. Our dedication to blockchain education and research creates an environment that encourages creativity among students. Joining BRC means being part of a community revolutionizing technology and innovation in the ever-evolving web3 landscape.

event1: Its a fun event where you can learn concepts of blockchain while playing very intresting games , Stay Tune and follow for Instagram Handle For More Updates , Registration Dates of the event will be out soon!!

question1: The clubs is open to any student, ranging from novice developers who are just starting, to advanced developers who want to further their skills.
question2: How frequently do events and workshops occur?
We have a hands-on session every month. We also hold workshops and showcases & we would recommend you to join our community to get updates.
question3: What should I carry when attending a workshop?
We recommend you carry with you a notebook, pen and a laptop because more often than not we make our hands dirty with code. Most importantly, carry along a healthy dose of curiosity and enthusiasm
question4: Who should I reach out to if I have any questions?
If you have any questions or comments, please don't hesitate to contact us by filling the form in Contact Us Page. We would be happy to stay engaged via email even after the event
